name: methyl 3-chloro-4-methoxybenzoate
Reason: The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The chlorine atom in the para position increases the melting point due to stronger London dispersion forces, typically by +60 °C. The methoxy group (CH3O-) adds polarity and potentially hydrogen bonding, which can increase the melting point by +20 °C. The presence of two functional groups, chlorine and methoxy, can disrupt the symmetry of the molecule, which may reduce the estimated effect of each functional group.
